Typography

Source: vignettes/typography.Rmd
typography.Rmd

San Francisco Family

San Francisco typeface consists of three large family of typefaces, SF Pro, SF Compact, and SF Mono. They are degined to be used in different Apple platforms, e.g., iOS, macOS. Each family has its own characteristic and is optimized for certain screensize and resolution. sfthemes is optimized for SF Pro, the most general variant of the typeface designed for iOS, iPadOS, and macOS.

Apple restricted the usage of the entire SF typeface family for developers who ar designing and developing applications for Apple’s platforms. Please keep this resctriction in mind when using and sharing your plots, if you are using SF Pro as the main typeface of the plots.

Moreover, distribution and repackaging of San Francisco family is prohibited, however, the fonts can be downloaded directly from Apple’s website. Download SF Pro

Usage

In order to use SF Pro, you can apply the sf_set_sf_pro function to the end of your ggplot customization commands. Keep in mind that if you have not installed and imported SF Pro correctly, this command will fail, or ggplot2 will ignore your font choice. See import_sf_pro for the instalation process of SF Pro.

library(ggplot2); library(sfthemes)

ggplot(diamonds, aes(carat)) +
  geom_histogram() +
  theme_sf_dark() + scale_colour_watchos_dark() +
  sf_set_sf_pro()

Inter, The Alternative

As an alternative, sfthemes uses the Inter family. Inter typeface is a free and open source, and you are free to use it in almost any way imaginable.

Inter is closely related to SF Pro. Like SF Pro, it is crafted and designed for computer screens, therefore sfthemes plots with Inter fonts will look a lot like their SF Pro variants.

Inter vs SF Pro

Usage

Inter is the default typeface of the sfthemes, and can be used without setting any special commands. However, sf_set_inter is available and can be used to change other themes’ font.

library(ggplot2); library(sfthemes)

# Changing 
ggplot(diamonds, aes(carat)) +
  geom_histogram() +
  sf_set_inter()

Dynamic Type Sizes

sfthemes has adjsuted and adapted all available dynamic type sizes as presented in Apple’s HIG. sfthems size classes are based on iOS font sizes with minor compatibility modifications. In total, there are 7 size classes available — i.e., xSmall, Small, Medium, Large, xLarge, xxLarge, xxxLarge — with Medium being the default class. With both theme_sf_light and theme_sf_dark, The font_size_scale parameter can be used to change the overall text sizes of a plot.

class Title Subtitle Body Ticks
xSmall 14 12 10 9
Small 15 13 11 10
Medium 16 14 12 11
Large 17 15 14 12
xLarge 19 17 15 14
xxLarge 21 19 17 16
xxxLarge 23 21 19 18
